label: 曲舞
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Form of accompanied dance, popular from the fourteenth to sixteenth centuries, that includes long narratives sung to drum accompaniment as well as dances by performers wearing hitatare, suikan, and eboshi. Elements of kusemai were later incorporated into the no drama.［直垂、水干、烏帽子、能］
